items.title: Shein unveils logistics expansion in China
items.summary:
- Shein has opened its Bay Area Smart Industrial Park in Zhaoqing, Guangdong province, China.
- The facility will start operations by the end of 2025 with an investment exceeding 10 billion yuan (approximately US$1.4 billion).
- It will add 260,000 square meters of warehouse space to Shein's existing 700,000 square meters in the city.
- Shein has invested in supply chain infrastructure in the Greater Bay Area for over a decade, with projects in cities like Guangzhou and Foshan.

items.title: Alibaba’s food delivery branch names new CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Wu Zeming appointed CEO of Ele.me, Alibaba's food delivery branch, on Feb. 11.
- Former CEO Han Liu to lead the Instant Logistics Center, reporting to Wu.
- Ele.me emphasizes the importance of instant logistics in an internal memo from Wu.
- Wu has been with Alibaba since 2004 and was named chairman of Ele.me in March 2024.
- Alibaba reported a 14% revenue growth in local services, totaling 17.7 billion yuan, and reduced operating loss by 85% to 391 million yuan.

items.title: BYD shares soar after DeepSeek’s driver-assist launch
items.summary:
- BYD's shares reached a record high of 345 Hong Kong dollars (US$44.24) on February 10.
- The increase marked a rise of over 4% during morning trade.
- This followed a 21% surge based on expectations of the announcement of the advanced driver-assistance system, "DiPilot."
- BYD is collaborating with AI startup DeepSeek to enhance its driver-assistance technology.
- Recent developments include plans to launch 21 EVs with a new driver assistance system called 'God’s Eye' and expansions in Thailand and Indonesia.

items.title: Oyo invests $10m in US-based G6 Hospitality’s digital assets
items.author: Ritesh Agarwal
items.summary:
- Oyo announces an investment of 86.6 crore rupees (US$10 million) to enhance G6 Hospitality's digital presence.
- G6 Hospitality operates brands like Motel 6 and Studio 6, acquired by Oyo for 4,382.72 crore rupees (US$525 million) in 2024.
- The investment aims to improve the Motel 6 website and My6 mobile application, intending to quadruple app installations.
- This move aligns with Oyo’s expansion strategy in the US, where it manages over 320 hotels across 35 states.

items.title: Baidu CEO urges more [AI investment](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=ai-investment) despite DeepSeek’s growth
items.author: Robin Li
items.summary:
- Robin Li, CEO of Baidu, stressed the importance of ongoing investment in cloud infrastructure for [AI development](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=ai-development).
- At the World Government Summit in Dubai, he emphasized that more compute is necessary to outperform other AI models.
- The comments followed the emergence of DeepSeek, a startup with less computational demands for AI models similar to OpenAI's GPT.
- Baidu is committed to heavy investments in AI, despite challenges from US chip sanctions and the need for open-source models to accelerate technology adoption.

items.title: Telio takes a final bow
items.summary:
- Telio, Vietnam's B2B ecommerce startup, has shut down after failing to secure additional funding or a buyer.
- Founded in 2019, Telio connected small retailers with larger brands but expanded too quickly.
- The company laid off 400 employees after attempts to scale back operations in mid-2022 were too late.

items.title: Meet the 20 top-funded startups and tech companies in Hong Kong
items.summary:
- List of the top 20 tech startups and companies in Hong Kong based on funding raised.
- Focuses on funding data from the past two years.
- Uses data from Tech in Asia to identify which companies may have global impact.

items.title: Microsoft adjusts pricing to address EU concerns: sources
items.summary:
- Microsoft is adjusting pricing to address EU antitrust scrutiny by increasing the price gap between its Office suite with Teams and the standalone Office product.
- The decision follows complaints from competitors about Microsoft's bundling practices, particularly from Slack in 2020.
- In 2023, Microsoft unbundled Teams from Office, allowing users to buy Office at a price 2 euros less than the bundled version, with standalone Teams priced at 5 euros per month.
- The goal of the new pricing is to enhance competitiveness of rival products in the market.

items.title: Two senior partners depart [Peak XV](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=venture+capital) after fund reduction
items.author: Shailesh Lakhani, Abheek Anand
items.summary:
- Shailesh Lakhani and Abheek Anand, senior partners at Peak XV, are leaving the firm after a fund reduction from US$2.85 billion to US$2.4 billion announced in October.
- Lakhani has been with Peak XV for 17 years and was pivotal in the investment of beauty brand Minimalist, among others preparing for IPOs.
- Anand co-led investments in [Southeast Asia](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=southeast+asia), with a portfolio including edtech company Cuemath and e-commerce firm Ula.
- Despite their departures, Peak XV continues to manage investments in over 400 companies, including 50+ unicorns.

items.title: India’s KiranaPro acquires grocery delivery service Joper.app
items.author: Deepak Ravindran
items.summary:
- KiranaPro has acquired Joper.app to expand its vendor network and enhance delivery services.
- Joper.app operates in 25 cities, including Ranchi, Kolkata, Jaipur, and Noida.
- The integration aims to support small retailers through technology and build an AI-powered ecosystem for Kirana stores.

items.title: Stripe considers employee share sale at $85b valuation
items.summary:
- Stripe Inc. is in talks to sell employee-held stock at a valuation of $85 billion.
- This would mark a $15 billion increase from last year's valuation of $70 billion.
- The new valuation remains below the $95 billion peak Stripe reached in 2021.
- Ongoing negotiations may alter the terms of the transaction.

items.title: Saudi megacity plans net-zero AI hub by 2028
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia’s Neom has partnered with DataVolt to develop a net zero AI project in its Oxagon industrial hub.
- The 1.5-gigawatt facility is set to launch by 2028, with an initial investment of US$5 billion.
- This initiative positions Saudi Arabia as a significant AI hub amid competition from the UAE and Qatar.
- Neom is part of Saudi’s Vision 2030, aiming to host 9 million residents and reduce oil dependence.
- Some large projects have been scaled back to prioritize infrastructure for international events due to financial constraints.

items.title: Singapore’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
A soap opera worth watching: AI industry
items.author: Collin
items.summary:
- The AI industry's narratives are likened to soap operas, with captivating storylines and ongoing drama.
- [Nvidia](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=nvidia)'s market value dropped by approximately US$588 billion following the DeepSeek saga, but it has since rebounded and is expected to surge.
- New US regulations on AI chip exports may hinder the growth of the AI sector in Southeast Asia, with Malaysia investing US$21.7 billion in [data centers](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=data%20centers) recently.
- Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang is attempting to influence US administration regarding tightening AI export regulations, which threaten significant revenue from international markets, particularly China.

items.title: Meta starts cutting jobs, targets AI talent overhaul
items.summary:
- Meta began layoffs on February 10, cutting 5% of its workforce (about 3,600 jobs).
- The cuts are aimed at improving workforce efficiency and attracting top AI talent.
- Impacted US employees will receive severance packages, including 16 weeks salary plus additional compensation based on years of service.
- These layoffs follow previous job cuts in 2022 and 2023 as Meta focuses on cost-cutting and AI investments.

items.title: TSMC lowers Q1 outlook due to January earthquake losses
items.summary:
- TSMC forecasts Q1 2025 revenue at the lower end due to January earthquake losses.
- Estimated losses of NT$5.3 billion (US$161 million) after insurance claims.
- No structural damage reported; normal operations have resumed.
- Revised Q1 revenue expected to be between US$25 billion and US$25.8 billion.
- TSMC is working to recover lost production and maintains its full-year outlook.

items.title: Australian initiative invests $8m in Indonesia’s climate fund
items.summary:
- Australian Development Investments (ADI) committed US$8 million to AC Ventures’ Climate and Sustainability Fund in Indonesia.
- The investment supports renewable energy, electric mobility, energy efficiency, waste management, circular economy initiatives, and climate-smart agriculture.
- The fund aims to reduce 10 megatons of CO2 emissions and marks ADI’s first investment under Kinetik, the Australia-Indonesia Climate, Renewable Energy, and Infrastructure Partnership.
- The announcement coincided with an Australian investor delegation visit to Indonesia, including representatives from Macquarie Group, ANZ Bank, and Aspen Medical.
- Australian companies have invested over US$4.3 billion in Indonesia in the last decade, with annual investments exceeding US$500 million.

items.title: Foxconn reports strong January sales, expects Q1 growth
items.summary:
- Foxconn reported robust sales figures for January.
- The company anticipates growth in the first quarter of the year.
- Increased demand for electronics contributed to the strong performance.

items.title: Indian spacetech firm Digantara expands to US
items.summary:
[Digantara, an Indian spacetech company, is expanding its operations to the US.]
[The company aims to enhance its capabilities in satellite data services and research.]
[This expansion aligns with the growing demand for space technology and satellite applications in various sectors.]

items.title: Indian eco-brand Honest Home raises $800k pre-series A
items.author: Mayank Sisodia, Sayan Ghosh, Gaurav Verma, Anupam Mittal
items.summary:
- Honest Home, an Indian sustainable home and kitchenware brand, raised US$800,000 in a pre-series A funding round.
- The round was led by Ortella Global Capital, co-founded by Sayan Ghosh and Gaurav Verma, with contributions from angel investor Anupam Mittal.
- Founded in 2019 by Mayank Sisodia, the company aims to expand operations and product offerings, which include air fresheners and eco-friendly cleaners.
- Funds will be used to scale production, improve distribution, and enhance eco-conscious initiatives.

items.title: Temu moves forward with S Korea entry plans: sources
items.summary:
- Temu, a Chinese ecommerce platform, is advancing its entry into South Korea.
- The company has been hiring Korean employees for roles in various departments since late 2024.
- Temu launched its Korean-language platform in July 2023 and created Whaleco Korea LLC in February 2024.
- As of January 2025, Temu ranks third in South Korea’s ecommerce sector with 8.23 million monthly active users, following Coupang and AliExpress.
- Domestic partners handling deliveries include CJ Logistics Corp. and Hanjin Logistics.
- A company spokesperson declined to comment on recruitment or market strategies.

items.title: [AI](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=ai) chip startup Groq secures $1.5b from Saudi Arabia
items.summary:
- Groq has secured a US$1.5 billion investment from Saudi Arabia for [AI chips](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=semiconductor) distribution.
- The announcement was made at Saudi Arabia’s LEAP 2025 tech event.
- The investment follows Groq's partnership with Aramco Digital, which launched an AI hub in December.
- Groq develops AI inference chips enhancing pre-trained models but has not revealed the investment's timeline or location.
- In August 2024, Groq raised US$640 million in a funding round led by Cisco Investments and others, achieving a US$2.8 billion valuation.

items.title: Mistral, Helsing partner to develop AI for defense
items.summary:
- [Mistral](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=mistral) and Helsing announced a partnership to develop AI for defense applications.
- The focus is on AI-powered [computer vision](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=technology) to improve situational analysis and decision-making in complex environments.
- Specific weapons systems and financial terms of the partnership were not disclosed.
- Helsing develops military software for drones and Eurofighter jets, while Mistral specializes in AI models.
- The defense sector is increasingly integrating AI technologies, highlighted by recent partnerships and updates from major tech companies.

items.title: Google AI chief calls DeepSeek’s cost claims “exaggerated”
items.summary:
- Demis Hassabis, head of Google’s DeepMind, challenged DeepSeek’s low development cost claims as "exaggerated and a little bit misleading."
- DeepSeek stated its AI model was developed with US$5.6 million in computing costs, which Hassabis argues does not represent total development expenses.
- DeepSeek has been noted for its performance using older Nvidia chips at lower costs compared to competitors like OpenAI and Google.
- Experts are skeptical of DeepSeek’s claims regarding their cost efficiency and performance.
- Hassabis speculated that DeepSeek might have used “distillation” techniques for model training, potentially relying on existing Western AI systems.
- DeepSeek has not provided a response to these allegations.

items.title: Ola Electric shares drop 4% as Q3 loss widens
items.summary:
- Ola Electric shares fell nearly 4% to 67.43 rupees on Feb. 10, settling at 67.80 rupees.
- The company reported a Q3 FY25 net loss of 564 crore rupees, up from 376 crore rupees in Q3 FY24, marking a 50% increase.
- Revenue declined by 19% year-on-year to 1.045 crore rupees due to heightened competition and service issues.
- Ola Electric remains India's leading electric two-wheeler manufacturer with a 64% increase in registrations to 22,656 units in January 2025, retaining a 25% market share.

items.title: Peak XV sells $52m Freshworks stake
items.summary:
- Venture capital firm Peak XV sold over 1% of its stake in Freshworks for US$52 million, reducing its holdings.
- Nearly 2.9 million shares were sold between Dec. 9 and Jan. 28, at prices from US$17 to US$19.20 per share.
- This follows a US$40 million share sale by Freshworks founder Girish Mathrubootham in December and a sale of 275,000 shares by WestBridge Capital in Q3 2024.
- Freshworks Q3 2024 revenue grew 21.4% year-on-year to US$186 million, driven by demand for AI-powered products.
- Recent developments include the appointment of a new chief product officer and significant revenue growth projections for upcoming quarters.

items.title: Mistral eyes new funding for AI data center expansion
items.summary:
- Mistral, a French AI startup, is seeking additional funding for a new data center near Paris to enhance AI processing.
- CEO Arthur Mensch emphasizes the importance of securing capital for this initiative.
- Since its inception in early 2023, Mistral has raised over €1 billion, achieving a valuation of €5.8 billion in June 2024.
- The move supports France's €109 billion AI investment plan for data center development, backed by the US, Canada, and the UAE.
- Recent funding milestones include a €600M raise in early 2025 and a €385M series A funding in December 2023.

items.title: Strategy invests $742m in bitcoin after rebrand
items.summary:
- Bitcoin treasury firm, Strategy (formerly MicroStrategy), acquired 7.633 bitcoin for US$742 million between Feb. 3 and Feb. 9, at an average price of US$97.255 per bitcoin.
- The firm now holds 478.740 bitcoin, worth over US$46 billion, representing 2.2% of Bitcoin’s total supply.
- Funding for acquisitions came from share sales raising US$179 million from Class A common stock and US$563 million from series A preferred shares.
- The company recently rebranded to Strategy, adding a new logo with the “₿” symbol, accumulating around US$20 billion in bitcoin after a brief pause.

items.title: How One Minister is Making Apple Sweat in Indonesia
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- In December 2024, Apple proposed a US$1 billion investment in Indonesia to lift a ban on iPhone 16.
- In February 2025, the iPhone 16 remains banned primarily due to Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita's holdout.
- The ban is related to regulations on local components enforced by the Ministry of Industry, led by Kartasasmita.
- Kartasasmita emphasized the Ministry's role in negotiating with Apple and stated that the Indonesian people are watching.
- Kartasasmita comes from a politically influential background and has a history in both politics and industry.

items.title: Former TSMC exec urges [Taiwan](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=taiwan)-US cooperation on chip tariffs
items.summary:
- A former executive from TSMC emphasizes the need for collaboration between Taiwan and the US regarding chip tariffs.
- The call for cooperation aims to strengthen the [semiconductor](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=semiconductors) supply chain amidst increasing global competition.
- The article discusses the implications of tariffs on the semiconductor industry and the importance of partnerships.

items.title: S Korea spy agency warns [DeepSeek](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=deepseek) collects excessive data
items.summary:
- South Korea's NIS warns that the app DeepSeek collects excessive personal data and records user chat inputs in a traceable manner.
- The app transmits data to Chinese servers, allowing advertisers unrestricted access to South Korean user data, increasing vulnerability under Chinese law.
- Several South Korean ministries have blocked the app due to its privacy concerns, following actions by Australia and Taiwan.
- DeepSeek provides inconsistent responses about cultural items and avoids politically sensitive queries.
- The app did not respond to requests for comment.

items.title: Indian beauty retailer Nykaa’s Q3 profit up 51%
items.summary:
- Nykaa’s Q3 FY25 net profit rose 51% YoY to 26.4 crore rupees (US$3 million), doubling from last quarter.
- Revenue from operations increased by 26.74% to 2.267 crore rupees (US$259), with GMV rising 25% to 4.527 crore rupees (US$517).
- The beauty segment contributed 2.060 crore rupees (US$235) in revenue, up 15%; fashion revenue rose 21% despite a 25.41 crore rupees (US$2 million) loss.
- Nykaa expanded to 221 stores across 73 cities and piloted 10-minute beauty product deliveries in Mumbai.

items.title: SoftBank eyes high-debt funding for [Stargate Project](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=stargate)
items.author: Masayoshi Son
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group is considering a high-debt financing model for its $500 billion Stargate Project, an [AI funding](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=ai%20funding) initiative with OpenAI.
- The Stargate Project aims to develop substantial datacenter capacity across Texas and other states with an initial investment of $100 billion.
- SoftBank may require a 10% equity contribution from stakeholders, with financing coming from preferred equity, mezzanine debt, and senior bank loans.
- The success of the financing plan largely depends on uncertain future AI service revenues.

items.title: DeepSeek boosts pricing as demand rises
items.summary:
- DeepSeek raises its pricing in response to increased demand.
- This change reflects a growing interest in their services.
- The company is aiming to enhance its market position amid rising competition.

items.title: Elon Musk offers $97b for OpenAI, Altman rejects it
items.summary:
- Elon Musk and investors propose a US$97.4 billion offer for OpenAI's nonprofit.
- The goal is to restore OpenAI's safety-focused and open-source mission.
- OpenAI CEO Sam Altman publicly rejects the offer, suggesting they could buy Twitter instead.
- The bid involves Musk’s xAI and several investors, including Valor Equity Partners and Baron Capital.

items.title: Tech giants launch initiative to boost child online safety
items.summary:
- A coalition of major tech companies, including [Alphabet Inc.](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=alphabet), OpenAI, Roblox Corp., and Discord, has launched an initiative named Robust Open Online Safety Tools (ROOST).
- The initiative was announced at the [Artificial Intelligence Action Summit](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=ai) in Paris on Feb. 10 and aims to improve child safety online.
- ROOST has secured over US$27 million in funding to develop free, open-source tools that combat online child exploitation.
- The tools will identify and report child sexual abuse material, enhancing safety measures online.
- Reports of suspected child exploitation have risen, with the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children noting a 12% increase from 2022 to 2023.
- Reports involving Roblox surged by 348%, while incidents linked to Discord doubled during the same period.

items.title: Malaysian fintech firm Payd raises $400k seed extension
items.summary:
- Malaysian fintech firm Payd raised US$400,000 in a seed extension funding round.
- Investors include A2D Ventures, Orbit Startups, and AngelSpark.
- The funding will enhance Payd’s Earned Wage Access (EWA) services, allowing employees to access earned wages before payday.
- Payd aims to reduce reliance on high-interest loans with its platform.
- The company reports over 100,000 users across various industries.

items.title: [Gushcloud](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=gushcloud), Azure launch fund to support digital creators
items.summary:
- Gushcloud International partners with [Azure Capital](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=azure) to create the Azure-Gushcloud Entertainment Finance Fund.
- The fund aims to support high-potential digital creators in growing their businesses sustainably.
- Objectives include diversifying income sources, building intellectual property, and expanding global reach.
- Azure Capital previously launched the Azure-Lyte Fund in 2019 for financing professionals.

items.title: 10 tech and startup companies hiring actively in Asia this week
items.author: Tech in Asia Jobs team
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia Jobs highlights 10 companies actively hiring across Asia.
- Various regions and job functions are covered in this week's roundup.
- Interested candidates are encouraged to click for more details on job roles and companies.
- Employers can post jobs for free via the provided link.

items.title: Indian banking tech firm raises $50m, valuation hits $2b
items.author: Bhavin Turakhia, Ramki Gaddipati
items.summary:
- Zeta, a banking software provider, has raised US$50 million from Optum, increasing its valuation to US$2 billion.
- This valuation is up from US$1.15 billion in 2021 after raising US$250 million from SoftBank Vision Fund 2.
- Founded in 2015, Zeta provides cloud-based technology for modernizing credit card management and lending services.
- Currently serving 25 million accounts, Zeta plans to onboard another 25 million, with the US as its largest market.
- The company generates over US$50 million annually in India and works with clients like HDFC Bank and Sparrow Financial.
- Zeta has invested about US$400 million in its platform and aims for profitability by March 2026.

items.title: BYD to launch 21 EVs with ‘God’s Eye’ driver assistance
items.summary:
- BYD announced plans to introduce 21 models with the 'God’s Eye' driver-assistance system on Feb. 10.
- The system will be available in three tiers to support various brands of BYD.
- This move aims to enhance BYD's competitiveness in the smart EV market.

items.title: Software firm Monday.com’s revenue jumps 33% in 2024
items.summary:
- Monday.com reports a 33% increase in revenue for 2024.
- Growth attributed to increased demand for project management software.
- Company continues to expand its product offerings and customer base.

items.title: DeepSeek hiring for advanced AI, pays up to $172k
items.summary:
- DeepSeek has opened job positions to develop artificial general intelligence (AGI).
- Available roles include data experts, deep-learning researchers, and a legal chief located in Beijing and Hangzhou.
- The AGI researcher position offers a salary of up to 1.26 million yuan (approximately US$172,000).
- Job requirements stress the need for technical skills in AI research or involvement in open-source projects, even for internships.

items.title: MENA startups raised $863m, led by Saudi fintechs
items.summary:
- Startups in MENA raised $863 million across 63 funding rounds in January 2025.
- $768 million of the total was generated through debt financing.
- Total funding increased by 210% month-on-month compared to December 2024.
- Saudi Arabia raised $839.5 million through 21 funding rounds.
- The fintech sector attracted $776.6 million from 11 deals, significantly driven by Lendo and Forus.

items.title: Saudi social media app Mush Social acquires fellow platform
items.summary:
- Mush Social, a social media app in Saudi Arabia, has acquired Pubbles, a platform launched in 2020.
- Financial terms of the acquisition were not disclosed.
- Pubbles was developed under the Taqadam Accelerator program and the Misk Launchpad initiative, recognized for its interactive virtual communities.
- Integration of the two platforms is planned within three months.

items.title: [Nokia](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=nokia) appoints Intel’s AI, data center head as new CEO
items.summary:
- [Justin Hotard](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=justin_hotard) is currently the executive vice president and general manager of the Data Center & AI Group at Intel.
- Lundmark, who became CEO in 2020, will serve as an advisor to Hotard until the end of the year.
- This transition follows Lundmark’s decision to step back from executive roles.

items.title: SEA’s pet tech firms have investors’ tails wagging
items.summary:
- Luxury brand Louis Vuitton launched its first dog accessory collection in October 2023, reflecting the rise of pet ownership globally.
- The pet care market in Asia Pacific is projected to grow at a CAGR of 4% from 2024 to 2029, outpacing North America and Western Europe.
- Singaporean pet owners spend an average of US$195 annually, while spending in Malaysia and Indonesia is significantly lower.
- Thailand is expected to see the fastest growth in the pet market with a CAGR of 8.7% from 2024 to 2029, driven by an established pet ecosystem.
- Mainstream brands are increasingly entering the pet market, offering products like grooming kits from Dyson and vacuums from Electrolux designed for pet hair removal.

items.title: Saudi construction tech Brkz raises $17m series A
items.author: Ibrahim Manna
items.summary:
- Brkz raises US$17 million in series A funding, totaling US$22.5 million since its founding in 2023.
- Funding includes US$8 million from series A2 closed in January 2025 and US$1 million in venture debt from Capifly.
- Investors include Beco Capital, Aramco’s Waed, and Better Tomorrow Ventures.
- Brkz aims to modernize construction procurement, allowing sourcing from over 1,100 suppliers and providing integrated financing options for construction cash flow.

items.title: OpenAI plans to develop its first AI chip
items.summary:
- OpenAI is developing its first in-house AI chip to reduce reliance on Nvidia.
- The chip design is expected to be completed in a few months, with production planned in collaboration with TSMC, targeting mass production by 2026.
- The custom chip aims to strengthen OpenAI's position with suppliers and enhance its infrastructure.
- The team, led by Richard Ho, a former Google executive, has expanded to 40 members and is collaborating with Broadcom.

items.title: US tariffs prompt Shein to shift production to Vietnam
items.summary:
- [Shein](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=shein) has requested key suppliers in China to set up production in Vietnam due to new US tariffs on imports from China.
- This move aims to mitigate the impact of the eliminated "de minimis" rule that previously exempted low-value shipments from tariffs.
- Shein is allowing longer production timelines for suppliers but clarifies it has no plans to increase production capacity in Vietnam significantly.
